problem.prob_desc:
27. 정규분포 $\mathrm{N}(m, 5^2)$을 따르는 모집단에서 크기가 49인 표본을 임의추출하여 얻은 표본평균이 $\overline{x}$일 때, 모평균 $m$에 대한 신뢰도 95%의 신뢰구간이 $a \leq m \leq \dfrac{6}{5}a$이다. $\overline{x}$의 값은? (단, $Z$가 표준정규분포를 따르는 확률변수일 때, $\mathrm{P}(|Z| \leq 1.96)=0.95$로 계산한다.) [3점]
① 15.2 ② 15.4 ③ 15.6 ④ 15.8 ⑤ 16.0

gpt-5-codex.title: Relate CI to sample mean
gpt-5-codex.body: For a 95% confidence interval with known population variance, the interval for m is x̄ ± z_{0.025}·(σ/√n). With σ = 5 and n = 49, the standard error is 5/7. Using z_{0.025} = 1.96, the margin of error becomes 1.96·(5/7). This must match the given interval a ≤ m ≤ (6/5)a derived from the sample mean.

gpt-5-codex.title: Set up equations using endpoints
gpt-5-codex.body: Compute the margin: 1.96·(5/7) = 9.8/7 = 1.4. Thus the lower bound is a = x̄ − 1.4 and the upper bound is (6/5)a = x̄ + 1.4. These two linear relations connect a and x̄ with the known margin terms.

gpt-5-codex.title: Solve for a and sample mean
gpt-5-codex.body: From a = x̄ − 1.4, substitute x̄ = a + 1.4 into (6/5)a = x̄ + 1.4 to get (6/5)a = (a + 1.4) + 1.4 = a + 2.8. Rearranging gives 14 = a. Therefore x̄ = a + 1.4 = 14 + 1.4 = 15.4.

gpt-5.title: Compute 95% CI half-width
gpt-5.body: For known σ=5 and n=49, the 95% CI for m is x̄ ± 1.96·(5/√49) = x̄ ± 1.96·(5/7). Thus the half-width h = 1.96·5/7 = 9.8/7 = 1.4.

gpt-5.title: Match given interval form
gpt-5.body: Given CI is [a, (6/5)a]. Its center is (a + 1.2a)/2 = 1.1a and its half-width is (1.2a − a)/2 = 0.1a. Set 0.1a = 1.4 ⇒ a = 14.

gpt-5.title: Find sample mean
gpt-5.body: x̄ equals the center of the interval: x̄ = 1.1a = 1.1·14 = 15.4. This corresponds to option ②.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Identify the confidence interval formula
claude-opus-4.5.body:
For a normal distribution N(m, σ²) with sample size n, the 95% confidence interval for the population mean m is:

$\bar{x} - z_{0.025} \cdot \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} \leq m \leq \bar{x} + z_{0.025} \cdot \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}$

Given: σ = 5, n = 49, z = 1.96

claude-opus-4.5.title: Calculate the margin of error
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Standard error = $\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} = \frac{5}{\sqrt{49}} = \frac{5}{7}$

Margin of error = $1.96 \times \frac{5}{7} = \frac{9.8}{7} = 1.4$

So the confidence interval is:
$\bar{x} - 1.4 \leq m \leq \bar{x} + 1.4$

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up equations from given interval
claude-opus-4.5.body:
The given confidence interval is: $a \leq m \leq \frac{6}{5}a$

Comparing with our calculated interval:
- Lower bound: $a = \bar{x} - 1.4$
- Upper bound: $\frac{6}{5}a = \bar{x} + 1.4$

claude-opus-4.5.title: Solve for a and x̄
claude-opus-4.5.body:
From the first equation: $a = \bar{x} - 1.4$

Substitute into the second equation:
$\frac{6}{5}(\bar{x} - 1.4) = \bar{x} + 1.4$

$\frac{6}{5}\bar{x} - \frac{6}{5}(1.4) = \bar{x} + 1.4$

$\frac{6}{5}\bar{x} - 1.68 = \bar{x} + 1.4$

$\frac{6}{5}\bar{x} - \bar{x} = 1.4 + 1.68$

$\frac{1}{5}\bar{x} = 3.08$

$\bar{x} = 15.4$

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate the margin of error
gemini-3-pro.body:
The formula for the 95% confidence interval for the population mean $m$ is $\overline{x} - k \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} \leq m \leq \overline{x} + k \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}$. 
Given $\sigma = 5$, $n = 49$, and for 95% confidence $k = 1.96$, we calculate the margin of error term:
$$k \frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}} = 1.96 \times \frac{5}{\sqrt{49}} = 1.96 \times \frac{5}{7} = 0.28 \times 5 = 1.4$$

gemini-3-pro.title: Set up equations based on the interval bounds
gemini-3-pro.body:
The confidence interval is $[\overline{x} - 1.4, \overline{x} + 1.4]$. The problem states this interval is $[a, \frac{6}{5}a]$. 
Therefore, we can write the system of equations:
1) $\overline{x} - 1.4 = a$
2) $\overline{x} + 1.4 = \frac{6}{5}a$

gemini-3-pro.title: Solve the system of equations for the sample mean
gemini-3-pro.body:
Substitute $a$ from the first equation into the second equation:
$$\overline{x} + 1.4 = \frac{6}{5}(\overline{x} - 1.4)$$ 
Multiply both sides by 5 to remove the fraction:
$$5(\overline{x} + 1.4) = 6(\overline{x} - 1.4)$$
$$5\overline{x} + 7.0 = 6\overline{x} - 8.4$$
$$6\overline{x} - 5\overline{x} = 7.0 + 8.4$$
$$\overline{x} = 15.4$$

grok-4-fast.title: Recall 95% confidence interval formula
grok-4-fast.body: For a normal distribution N(m, σ²) with known σ, sample size n, and sample mean bar{x}, the 95% confidence interval for m is bar{x} ± z_{(0.025)} * (σ / √n), where z_{(0.025)} = 1.96. Here, σ = 5, n = 49.

grok-4-fast.title: Identify center of given interval
grok-4-fast.body: The given interval is a ≤ m ≤ (6/5)a = 1.2a. The center (sample mean bar{x}) is the midpoint: (a + 1.2a)/2 = 2.2a/2 = 1.1a. The half-length is (1.2a - a)/2 = 0.2a/2 = 0.1a, so full length 0.2a.

grok-4-fast.title: Equate lengths to solve for a
grok-4-fast.body: The length of the confidence interval is 2E = 2 * 1.4 = 2.8. Set equal to given length: 0.2a = 2.8, so a = 2.8 / 0.2 = 14. Then bar{x} = 1.1a = 1.1 * 14 = 15.4.

grok-4-fast.title: Verify the interval
grok-4-fast.body: For a = 14, interval is 14 ≤ m ≤ 16.8. Midpoint: (14 + 16.8)/2 = 15.4. Distance from mean: 15.4 - 14 = 1.4 and 16.8 - 15.4 = 1.4, matching E = 1.4.
